title: Oh, Riot removed one of the few masteries that benefitted tanks more than damage dealers.
body:
Oppressor->Removed. 

Replaced by Double-Edged Sword. 

Gee, thanks Riot.

replies.body: Battle trance.

Oh, you mean the new fighter/skirmisher/ADC mastery?

Most tanks have their damage front-loaded into their engage.

Appreciate you taking your time to visit the thread, though. (actually not sarcasm)

Questions could be raised about concepts such as tanks NEEDING to supply a large damage increase into the fight in the first place, allowing the enemy team to scale high enough into the late game to wreck your tanks even allowing for defensive itemization ala Thornmail etc, tanks being dependent on a single mastery that while rewarding their high cc output was not entirely intended for them specifically, etc.

From what I'm seeing the damage choices now are between a 7.5% damage increase w/ 5 unique kills (highest damage increase, but a cost paid in having to get those 5 unique kills aka why most peeps were taking Oppressor instead), a 5% flat damage increase with a 2.5% increase in damage taken (you get your damage increase flat but pay for it in taking more up the a - - ), and a 5% damage increase with its cost paid in a 5sec charge-up time of 1%damage/sec. In that light, Oppressor had no actual cost for its damage increase apart from the need for the target to be afflicted by impaired movement (even slows), and the fact that cc'd enemies are far more prevalent in the game than five-man teams of easily-killed champions meant that though Oppressor's benefit was smaller than a farmed Bounty Hunter's, it was far more reliable to proc and therefore accounted for higher damage overall than Bounty Hunter's promises.

I guess the question here is: should tanks have to worry about their options for dealing higher damage to the enemy team themselves? They're already providing a meat shield that trips up and belly slams the enemy so that your f'ing Teemo can drag them to hell screaming (even more so in the new patch). And if the concern were about "being melted down in the late game", well, what does that say about fighters/skirmishers/adcs who are much much squishier and therefore more likely to worry about melting?

Considering tanks can't actually tank for significant periods anymore, relative to season 5 and earlier, they need to contribute more during those periods. 

So yes. They do need the damage options. 

If they want tanks to deal less damage (or use the new fighter/ADC mastery), they need to be able to tank for longer periods of time. By the time 5 seconds have passed, any fight, trade, or skirmish has already been decided. It DOES NOT benefit tanks.

You are kinda wrong here. Tanks need damage for up to small number skirmishes, not full out teamfights. For the later they need durability and cdr to peel/lockdown for more exnteded periods of time. As number of enemies goes down, the expected time goes up along with damage contribution of the tank. And there it shines.

Which is why it's annoying for Oppresor to be removed. It was a damage amp that specifically helped tanks. 

Now the only one in ferocity is exposed weakness.

Actually, most fighters and skirmishers have quite alot frontloaded damage aswell, it's prettymuch only juggernauts that have it somewhat backloaded.
Melees with backloaded damage simply don't work at the current state of the game...
Oppressor was too ubiquitous. Aside from just being a "Here, have some free damage :D" for most tanks, it was also too generally good on mages and even fighters as long as they had any cc at all.

So any of the other masteries that are taken 100% of the time by specific roles aren't too ubiquitous? 

There's absolutely nothing wrong with Oppressor relative to the rest of the trees. 

If you say Oppressor was too ubiquitous, you should instead be saying that all three trees need to be scrapped and redone (they do).

___________

**Ferocity**

T1 was one or the other based on abilities/auto attacks

T2 is feast unless you're bad or have way too much sustain already

T3 was Natural Talent.

T4 was oppressor if you had any CC

T5 was one or the other depending on AD or AP

**Cunning**

T1 is Savagery unless you're support/jungler

T2 Solo lane? Assassin. Jungler? Runic.

T3 Always Merciless unless you want to AFK farm

T4 Are you a support or Gangplank? No? Dangerous Game

T5 Do you rely on one rotation or two?

**Resolve**

All left side or you're a fool

_____________

And you're going to say Oppressor, specifically, was too ubiquitous?

Double Edged Sword is good for assassins like Talon or Zed lol. I never take Feast on them 

Wanderer is viable on roaming mids.
Stash is good on many mages, and in counter lanes. 
Meditation is good on severely mana hungry champions 

Unyielding is also pretty good
 lol I dunno what you're talking about dude there are a fair number of situational masteries.

Just to add for that, there are situational for the same champion. Eg lets take Vi for example. Do you go AS or ability damage? Really depends on the match and how much you expect to live. Short term ability damage is good for burst, but if you manage to survive long, AS provides better clear and dps.

FEROCITY
T2 double edge sword was very common even on adc
T3 a lot of champions took vampirism, even rarely some mages

CUNNiNG
T1 wanderer was really helpful to roam and often picked
T2 secret stash was pretty common, a weak early game champion couldn't use assassin very well
T3 meditation isn't bad but people always prefer more damage

RESOLVE
T1 saw both used
T2 explorer was cool but tough skin wasn't bad early
T3 runic armor was more common but not universally used, not every champion have shield or innate sustain
T4 insight was always good but a lot of champions could have used perseverance
How does this help tanks? It's the only skill in ferocity that they would like
Why remove oppressor though?

this is only going to benefit juggernauts more than anything. 

Darius, Illaoi, and maybe Nasus; does this affect the damage of his Q?

the only masteries juggernauts even synergize with is runic armor, tenacity and legendary guardian. and the last 2 are taking up the same slot.

why would i not go for like 20% much less situational damage increase in ferocity + cunning over shit like 2 damage blocked and some resistances next to turrets?

even the new fearless mastery is not that great considering it only lasts for 2 seconds on a 9 second cooldown. its more for engage tanks who pick it together with colossus and legendary guardian for a massive burst of defense when hard engaging into the middle of the enemy team.

if I can't take Courage, I'm going either TLD or fervor on my tanks - both the DPS trees got buffed to high hell (which is funny since they were already strong in S5) while in Resolve my new options (aside from the awesome shield) amount to: well, you're going to be hanging next to your turret as a tank anyway with all this new damage we're adding to the other trees so here's a bone: 8 armor/MR!
Actually, unless I  missed something, double-edged sword is where oppressor used to be, so now people need to pick whether they want scaling damage, flat damage, or power-over-time, right?

That would be correct, but the flat damage is the only choice that has an increase to damage taken as a downside, as opposed to being gated by time/kills respectively. I'm actually not sure why OP is complaining, Battle Trance seems great on those tankier champions who wanted more damage.

A few reasons. 

A) Battle Trance wasn't listed at the time

B) It benefits fighters WAY more than tanks, especially since tanks have most of their damage front-loaded. 

C) Tanks no longer have that early-mid game period, before Bounty Hunter usually came into its own. Since tanks get melted late game despite surviving being their entire goal, that early-mid game advantage is kind of warranted. Its mitigated now.

__________

If tanks could actually survive that long late game, yeah, maybe. 

However, currently they get bullied out of early game if they aren't in the jungle, and they get melted late game. Oppressor fit the the perfect in-between.

Tanks don't need more damage. They need more defenses. It is the fact Tanks are allowed to deal decent damage in the first place that has caused such a mumbo jumbo of balance problems in the past.

If engages are going to be as short as they are, yes they do need damage so they have a relevant impact. Just being a one-and-done CC-bot in this meta isn't relevant impact if you're not a support. 

If tanks could tank for longer periods, I would definitely agree that they don't need more damage (part of why Alistar losing his AD on ult is a good thing). However, Riot seems vehemently against enabling such things. As it currently stands, they do need the damage.

Not only that, but tanks already suffer during laning. If they don't have a relevant threat 1v1, they essentially cannot function outside of jungle/support. Most tanks don't have kits that allow them to function well as a jungle/support.
Have you see the new courage of colossus keystone? Tanks are going to be absolutely godlike if that mastery remains as is.
I never use DES that much, kinda sad

Actually, objectives and team-fighting revolve around the damage dealers. Tanks are just a way for yours to move in towards theirs. 

Hard to say they're better at teamfighting if the most important roles in team-fights aren't tanks. You can only really make that argument if you're talking about assassins. 

Tanks don't usually go down Cunning because Feast and relevance awaits in the Ferocity tree. If you don't go down Ferocity as a tank, you're probably a support.

Honestly riot either needs to buff some choice tanks like they buffed nunu or they need to rework them so that they can have some actual presence in the game. Because right now they are basically ignored and most teams don't even pick tanky tops anymore. Like sion and malphite have a super hard time in lane and are basically cannon fodder until mid game then after it the adcs build armor pen and jsut wreck your face the rest of the game while you are trying to peel. 

With the new lethality changes and not its gonna scale they are gonna need to buff them or you will see a rengar top meta and no one wants to see that (except maybe rengar mains). Honestly i wish i could play sion, nasus, volibear but they get rofl stomped by laners like riven and irelia since they both can still provide cc and peel kinda for their teams. Its not really fair for you have a bad laning phase, poor mid game if you didnt go even cs and then be the hot butter their adc/riven cuts through in late game. This is why i stopped playing them and why the only real tanks left are malphite and singed since they basically have escapes to be safe and go at least even then be able to scale into mid game. This is why you see the jayce, kennen, yasuo tops now also since riot has basically nerfed or ignored all the other tanks for so long. 

With the lethality changes i don't see myself picking up top lane tanks again any time soon. The worst part is that riot is basically gonna force the rengar and ad carry top lane with these changes and tanks are gonna go almost out the window. Maybe i am just jaded but it would be nice for tanks to have an actual place in the game instead of the o welp lost lane, could do nothing mid game and got melted late game and now with lethality the ad is gonna scale better into me so i guess i'm packing my bags and heading into the jungle/support role. 

One last thing i might add on my way out is that the top lane is gonna be even worse than the jungle after these changes and right now unless riot fixes something the assassin rework could be as bad as the juggernaut patch was. WELP I'll see you top side when i pick up rengar and play him till he is nerfed maybe even pick up the other soon-to-be broken champions (perhaps you will see the kha'zix\talon top too and riven could only get stronger on this patch) until they nerf 'em back to the juggernaut patch.
Because tanks need more damage. They're already doing as much as Marksman but that's not enough for Riot. We need to ruin the balance EVEN MORE
